availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James Andrew Jackson Lee (Owingsville, Kentucky, merchant)

body.p: Owingsville, Kentucky, merchant. Kentucky native. Married to Maria M. Lee. Father of Sarah A. Lee, Amelia S. Lee, John C. Lee, Emily F. Lee, Mary N. Lee, Jim Lee, Alexander Lee, and Ellie Lee. Merchant in Bath County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned three enslaved persons in Bath County in 1850. Merchant in Owingsville in 1860. Owned three enslaved persons in Owingsville in 1860.

ab.bibl: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, 2nd Division, p. 1A. Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, 2nd Division. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, Owingsville, p. 1. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, Owingsville, p. 1. Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, Owingsville, p. 4.
